title: 2016 Democratic National Committee email leak
added: Throughout late 2017 into early 2018, numerous individuals gave testimonies to the [[House Permanent Select Committee on Intelligence]] (HPSCI) who were charged with carrying out an investigation into the series of cyberattacks<ref>https://intelligence.house.gov/russiainvestigation/</ref>.

title: 2016 Democratic National Committee email leak
added: Throughout late 2017 into early 2018, numerous individuals gave testimonies to the [[House Permanent Select Committee on Intelligence]] (HPSCI) who were charged with carrying out an investigation into the series of cyberattacks<ref>https://intelligence.house.gov/russiainvestigation/</ref>.

title: 2016 Democratic National Committee email leak
added: Throughout late 2017 into early 2018, numerous individuals gave testimonies to the [[House Permanent Select Committee on Intelligence]] (HPSCI) who were charged with carrying out an investigation into the series of cyberattacks<ref>https://intelligence.house.gov/russiainvestigation/</ref>.On 5th December 2017, Shawn Henry - a representative testifying on behalf of [[Crowdstrike]] - testified to the (HPSCI) at the [[Capitol]]. When probed for exact details, Henry conceded that there was no evidence the data was removed as part of a hack: "''There are times when we can see data exfiltrated, and we can say conclusively. But in this case, it appears it was set up to be exfiltrated, but we just don't have the evidence that says it actually left''".<ref>https://intelligence.house.gov/UploadedFiles/SH21.pdf</ref><ref>https://news.antiwar.com/2020/12/22/joe-biden-rips-trump-for-hack-response-vows-retaliation/</ref>

title: 2016 Democratic National Committee email leak
added: Throughout late 2017 into early 2018, numerous individuals gave testimonies to the [[House Permanent Select Committee on Intelligence]] (HPSCI) who were charged with carrying out an investigation into the series of cyberattacks<ref>https://intelligence.house.gov/russiainvestigation/</ref><ref>https://www.cnn.com/2017/06/21/politics/jeh-johnson-congress-hearing/index.html</ref>
